document.discussion_title: North Otago man dies in hospital after crash into tree near Oamaru
document.topic_text: North Otago man dies in hospital after crash into tree near Oamaru RYAN DUNLOP Last updated 17:30, August 12 2016 ROBERT STEVEN/FAIRFAX NZ Waitaki man Ronald Martin Scott, 85, has died in Dunedin Hospital overnight after a vehicle he was in crashed into a tree on Wednesday night. North Otago man Ronald Martin Scott, 85, has died in hospital a day after a serious crash south of Oamaru. Scott and his wife, 80, were airlifted to Dunedin Hospital after their vehicle crashed on McLeods Rd, off State Highway 1, Sergeant Blair Wilkinson, of Oamaru, said. Their vehicle collided with a tree about 7.35pm on Wednesday. Scott died overnight on Thursday. A St John spokesperson said an Otago Rescue Helicopter, two ambulances and a first-response vehicle went to the single-vehicle crash, about 4 kilometres south of Oamaru. The couple were taken to Oamaru Hospital, then flown to Dunedin with serious injuries, the spokesperson said. Wilkinson said police were still investigating the crash. The woman remained in a serious condition in Dunedin Hospital, he said.
